borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>The proposed side dormer windows, by reason of their mass, would appear disproportionate and unduly dominate the existing dwellinghouse and harm the wider street scene on Atlantis Close.&nbsp; The proposed development is therefore contrary to:</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</p><p>- Policies 7.4, 7.5 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</p><p>- Policies D4 and D8 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</p><p>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</p><p>- Policy BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</p><p>- Policies SP2,&nbsp; SP4, DMD1 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19)<br></p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</p>

<p>The proposed single storey side element would lead to a loss of openness between nos. 18 &amp; 20 and project away from the existing dwellinghouse at an irregular angle. Therefore, the development would disrupt the character and symmetry of the dwelling in relation to its semi-detach which is thereby detrimental to the wider street scene.&nbsp; The proposed development is therefore contrary to:</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</p><p>- Policies 7.4, 7.5 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</p><p>- Policies D4 and D8 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</p><p>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</p><p>- Policy BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</p><p>- Policies SP2,&nbsp; SP4, DMD1 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19)</p><p>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</p>
description: Construction of a rear dormer extension including one roof light to the front and two roof lights to the side and construction of single storey rear and part side extension.
